bibl.title: Letter from Samuel Taylor Darling to Frederick F. Russell, January 15, 1924

div1.p: Darling sends a medical report of the microscopic examination of tissue slides.

div1.head: Letter from Samuel Taylor Darling to Frederick F. Russell, January 15, 1924
div1.opener:
COPY
Leesburg, Ga.
Jan. 15-1924
Dear Dr. Russell:
div1.p:
I enclose a microscopic examination of Dr. Muller's slides
of, “Tissues of woman patient referred to in Dr. Hanson's letter of
November 6th.” There are no evidences of yellow fever in this tissue.

These slides were sent to me by Miss Tilden, Dr. Noguchi's
secretary, and are referred to in Miss Read's letters of December 28th and
January 11th. I have not previously seen tissue nor slides from this case
nor have I a copy of the history. I should be very glad to have a copy of
this history if you can have one sent to me.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, (Signed) Samuel Darling Dr. F. F. Russell, General Director,
International Health Board
61 Broadway, New York City
